text: Henning Mankell (3 February 1948 â€“ 5 October 2015) was a Swedish writer. He was born in Stockholm. He wrote stories both for the theatre as well as books and television series. He is best known for a series of crime novels, starring a character he created, inspector Kurt Wallander. Mankell died of throat and lung cancer in Gothenburg, Sweden on 5 October 2015 at the age of 67. == References == Category:1948 births Category:2015 deaths Category:Crime writers Category:Children's writers Category:Swedish novelists Category:Writers from Stockholm Category:Swedish playwrights Category:Television writers
title: Henning Mankell
